greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of phi(-x) * phi(x^5) / (chi(-x^2) * chi(-x^10)) in powers of x where phi(), chi() are Ramanujan theta functions.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of q^(-1/2) * eta(q)^2 * eta(q^4) * eta(q^10)^4 / (eta(q^2)^2 * eta(q^5)^2 * eta(q^20)) in powers of q.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (40 t)) = 20^(1/2) (t/i) g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g(t) is the g.f. for A143323.
mathematica: a[ n_] := If[ n < 0, 0, (-1)^n DivisorSum[ 2 n + 1, KroneckerSymbol[ -20, #]&]]; (* _Michael Somos_, Nov 12 2015 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<0, 0, (-1)^n * sumdiv(2*n + 1, d, kronecker( -20, d)))};
(PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x + A)^2 * eta(x^4 + A) * eta(x^10 + A)^4 / (eta(x^2 + A)^2 * eta(x^5 + A)^2 * eta(x^20 + A)), n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Apr 13 2007
